summary: This document is an email exchange from August 14, 2019, between an Associate Warden at MCC New York and a former colleague from the FCC Forrest City Education Department. The Associate Warden references being the subject of false information, taking heat for their boss, and maintaining staff morale during a difficult time.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.role: Associate Warden at Metropolitan Correctional Center New York
persons.context: The sender of the main email reply, who works at MCC New York and mentions being targeted with false information to take heat off their boss.

persons.name: Education Department FCC Forrest City
persons.role: Staff member at Federal Correctional Complex Forrest City
persons.context: The initial email sender, a former colleague who admired the Associate Warden and offers prayers and support.

connections.description: Former colleagues from the corrections system; the FCC Forrest City staff member admired the Associate Warden and kept up with their career progress.
The Associate Warden implies willingness to absorb false accusations to divert attention or 'heat' from their boss.

events.title: Email Exchange Regarding False Allegations
events.description: An email exchange where the Associate Warden at MCC New York discusses being the subject of fake and non-factual information, suggesting it is intended to divert attention from their boss.

locations.name: MCC New York
locations.address: 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: Workplace of the Associate Warden; the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations.name: FCC Forrest City
locations.context: Federal Correctional Complex in Forrest City; workplace of the initial email sender.

locations.name: Yazoo
locations.context: Mentioned as a location where the Associate Warden and the sender previously worked together at the start of the sender's career.

keyFacts: An Associate Warden at MCC New York claims to be the target of 'fake and non-factual information' intended to divert attention ('take the heat off of') their boss.
The correspondence occurs on August 14, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in MCC New York custody on August 10, 2019, suggesting a possible contextual link.
The Associate Warden expresses defiance, stating they know the truth and will not be provoked into a response, indicating a tense environment.
The email includes a biblical quote (Exodus 23:1-2) warning against false testimony and malicious gossip, framing the situation in moral terms.
The staff at MCC New York are described as needing uplift during 'this time,' pointing to institutional stress.
